quote: Supposing doesn’t fill the grain basket ‘if’ doesn’t fill the larder.
author: Ovambo Proverb

quote: There are no shortcuts to the top of the palm tree.
author: Cameroonian Proverb

quote: All monkeys cannot hang on the same branch.
author: Kenyan Proverb

quote: Those who are absent are always wrong.
author: Congolese Proverb

quote: God has created lands with lakes and rivers for man to live. And the desert so that he can find his soul.
author: Tuareg Proverb

quote: Do not allow the belly to make you useless.
author: Maasai Proverb

quote: Little by little grow the bananas.
author: Congolese Proverb

quote: If you overtake a leader, you break your neck.
author: Ugandan Proverb

quote: The big game often appears when the hunter has given up the hunt for the day.
author: Igbo Proverb

quote: A clever king is the brother of peace.
author: South African Proverb

quote: Do not call to a dog with a whip in your hand.
author: Sudanese Proverb

quote: The blame of the antelope is on the hunter.
author: Kenyan Proverb

quote: Good music goes with good food.
author: African Proverb

quote: A fully grown up tree cannot be bent into a walking stick.
author: Kenyan Proverb

quote: Haste and hurry can only bear children with many regrets along the way.
author: Senegalese Proverb

quote: No matter how full the river, it still wants to grow.
author: Congolese Proverb

quote: Birds of all kinds will end up landing.
author: Egyptian Proverb

quote: I shall come for the cows after the donkeys have grown horns.
author: Meru Proverb

quote: If love is a sickness, patience is the remedy.
author: Cameroonian Proverb

quote: Other people’s wisdom prevents the king from being called a fool.
author: Nigerian Proverb

quote: Knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand.
author: Guinean Proverb

quote: Ingratitude is sooner or later fatal to its author.
author: Twi Proverb

quote: The laughter of a child lights up the house.
author: Swahili proverb

quote: Even an ant can hurt an elephant.
author: South African Proverb

quote: Examine what is said, not him who speaks.
author: Egyptian Proverb

quote: One camel does not make fun of the other camel’s hump.
author: Ghanaian Proverb

quote: If you educate a man you educate one individual, but if you educate a woman you educate a family.
author: Fanti Proverb

quote: The sun never sets without fresh news.
author: Xhosa Proverb

quote: The good mother knows what her children will eat.
author: Akan Proverb

quote: If the elders leave you a legacy of dignified language, you do not abandon it and speak childish language.
author: Ghanaian Proverb

quote: He who does not seize opportunity today, will be unable to seize tomorrow’s opportunity.
author: Somali Proverb

quote: Rich people sometimes eat bad food.
author: Kikuyu Proverb

quote: He who refuses to obey cannot command.
author: Kenyan Proverb

quote: The chameleon changes color to match the earth, the earth doesn’t change colors to match the chameleon.
author: Senegalese Proverb

quote: If you damage the character of another, you damage your own.
author: Yoruba Proverb

quote: He who doesn’t clean his mouth before breakfast always complains that the food is sour.
author: African Proverb

quote: You cannot climb to the mountain top without crushing some weeds with your feet.
author: Ugandan Proverb

quote: The friends of our friends are our friends.
author: Congolese Proverb

quote: An empty pot makes the loudest noise.
author: Kenyan Proverb

quote: When the lion cannot find meat, it eats grass.
author: Kenyan Proverb

quote: What is bad luck for one man is good luck for another.
author: Ashanti Proverb

quote: A bridge is repaired only when someone falls into the water.
author: Somali Proverb

quote: No tattoo is made without blood.
author: Mozambican Proverb

quote: If your mouth turns into a knife, it will cut off your lips.
author: Rwandan Proverb

quote: If while climbing a tree you insist on going beyond the top, the earth will be waiting for you.
author: African Proverb

quote: Copying everyone else all the time, the monkey one day cut his throat.
author: Zulu Proverb

quote: No matter how beautiful and well crafted a coffin might look, it will not make anyone wish for death.
author: African Proverb

quote: If two wise men always agree, then there is no need for one of them.
author: Zambian Proverb

quote: If you are filled with pride, then you will have no room for wisdom.
author: Tanzanian Proverb

quote: The roaring lion kills no prey
author: Nigerian Proverb
